definition: thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Amy and Wendy have some string.
The scarlet cord was a sign to the spies she wanted to be rescued by them.
sentences.chinese: 朱红线绳是给探子们的暗号，告诉他们她想获救。

sentences.english: The driving mechanism further realizes flexible winding of multi-head cords.
sentences.chinese: 也可使多头线绳实现柔性卷绕。

sentences.english: He kneeled against the bow and, for a moment, slipped the line over his back again.
sentences.chinese: 他靠着船头跪了一会儿，然后又把线绳背在背上。

sentences.english: Besides, the thread rope is respectively curled around the pollex and the middle finger and can prevent the cover body from falling off.
sentences.chinese: 且该线绳分别卷绕于姆指及中指上，可防止套体脱落。

sentences.english: to fix with a string a cross in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 用线绳将十字架固定在天空里。

sentences.english: Lead a flying bird with a kite rope then take a walk.
sentences.chinese: 用风筝线绳牵着一只飞鸟散步。

sentences.english: So she sent them away and they departed. And she tied the scarlet cord in the window.
sentences.chinese: 于是打发他们去了，又把朱红线绳系在窗户上。

sentences.english: Put a scarlet cord out of her window which was on the side of the city wall.
sentences.chinese: 把朱红线绳系在她的窗户上，窗户就在城墙的一侧。

definition: thin bamboo strips used for basket weaving
